energy: Refrigeration and cold chain energy optimisation including door management and insulation upgrades
Heat recovery from cooking, pasteurisation, and sterilisation processes
LED lighting retrofit across production, packaging, and cold storage areas
Installation of variable-frequency drives on pumps, compressors, and conveyors
Evaluation of biogas generation from organic process waste
emissions: Refrigerant leak detection and management programme to reduce fugitive emissions
Monthly monitoring of boiler and oven fuel consumption
Quarterly GHG inventory covering Scope 1 (combustion, refrigerants) and Scope 2 (grid electricity)
Fleet emissions tracking for distribution vehicles and agricultural equipment
Evaluation of low-GWP refrigerants for cold storage and transport
waste: Organic waste segregation and composting or anaerobic digestion diversion
Food production waste reduction programme including yield optimisation and trim management
Packaging waste minimisation through lightweighting and material reduction
By-product valorisation â€” converting process waste into animal feed, fertiliser, or energy
Segregated waste streams: organic, packaging, hazardous cleaning chemicals, general waste
water: Water recycling and reuse in cleaning-in-place (CIP) and rinsing operations
Wastewater treatment for process effluent including BOD/COD management
Water metering at major process points: washing, processing, cleaning, boiler feed
Dry cleaning techniques and optimised cleaning schedules to reduce water consumption
Stormwater management and separation from process water drainage on agricultural sites

health_safety: Food hygiene and HACCP-based safety protocols for all production staff
Allergen management procedures and training for handling and labelling
Cold environment working protocols including exposure limits and PPE provision
Knife and cutting equipment safety training and cut-resistant PPE
Manual handling training for warehouse and production operatives
Slip, trip, and fall prevention programme in wet processing environments
Incident and near-miss reporting with food safety and occupational safety integration
training: Food safety and hygiene induction for all new production staff (HACCP Level 2 or equivalent)
Allergen awareness training and competency verification
Pest control awareness and good manufacturing practice (GMP) training
Supervisor development programme focused on food safety leadership
First-aid and fire warden training for designated employees per shift
labor_practices: Working hours tracking including seasonal overtime management
Fair wage practices benchmarked against local and industry standards
Migrant and seasonal worker welfare provisions and accommodation standards
Employee engagement and retention programme for production workforce
Grievance mechanism accessible to all workers including agency and seasonal staff

governance: Anti-bribery and corruption awareness integrated into employee and supplier onboarding
Food fraud prevention and authenticity programme
Confidential reporting channel for food safety and ethical concerns
Customer and product data protection measures
Annual management review of food safety, compliance, and business ethics

procurement: Raw material traceability for key ingredients to farm or origin level
Supplier qualification including food safety certification (BRC, FSSC 22000, IFS) verification
Preference for certified sustainable ingredients (Rainforest Alliance, Fairtrade, MSC, organic)
Periodic supplier audits covering food safety, labour conditions, and environmental practices
Palm oil, soy, and other deforestation-linked commodity sourcing policy
Packaging supplier assessment including recyclability and recycled content evaluation

ENVIRONMENT.vision: committed to minimising the environmental impact of our food production and agricultural operations, with a focus on water stewardship, waste reduction, and sustainable sourcing
ENVIRONMENT.formal: Our Environmental Policy, endorsed by senior management, establishes our commitment to resource efficiency, organic waste diversion, responsible water use, and compliance with applicable environmental legislation
ENVIRONMENT.informal: Environmental management is embedded in our daily operations through waste segregation, water monitoring, cold chain efficiency measures, and by-product recovery programmes
ENVIRONMENT.roadmap: We are developing a formalised Environmental Policy for publication in {year}, building on our existing waste management, water treatment, and energy monitoring practices

LABOR.vision: committed to providing a safe, hygienic, and fair working environment for all employees across our food production operations
LABOR.formal: Our Health, Safety & Food Safety Policy establishes our commitment to HACCP-based food safety, occupational safety, fair labour practices, and compliance with food industry regulations
LABOR.informal: Worker safety and food safety are managed through established protocols including HACCP procedures, hygiene training, working hours tracking, and accessible grievance mechanisms
LABOR.roadmap: We are formalising our health, safety, and labour management approach into a documented policy for {year}, aligning with BRC/FSSC requirements and ISO 45001 principles

ETHICS.vision: committed to conducting business with integrity, food authenticity, and respect for workers, communities, and the environment
ETHICS.formal: Our Code of Business Conduct outlines expectations for ethical behaviour, food integrity, anti-corruption, and compliance throughout our operations and supply chain
ETHICS.informal: Ethical business conduct expectations are communicated through onboarding, reinforced through food safety culture, and supported by our food fraud prevention programme
ETHICS.roadmap: We are developing a formal Code of Conduct for {year}, consolidating our food integrity, ethics, and compliance expectations into a documented framework

SUPPLY_CHAIN.vision: committed to responsible sourcing, ingredient traceability, and maintaining food safety, ethical, and environmental standards throughout our supply chain
SUPPLY_CHAIN.formal: Our Supplier Code of Conduct establishes minimum expectations for food safety certification, ingredient traceability, labour standards, and environmental performance for all suppliers
SUPPLY_CHAIN.informal: Supply chain management is conducted through supplier food safety audits, ingredient traceability programmes, and preference for certified sustainable raw materials
SUPPLY_CHAIN.roadmap: We are developing a formal Supplier Code of Conduct for {year}, extending our existing food safety-based supplier management to include comprehensive ESG criteria and deforestation-free sourcing commitments
